Alberto Molino Benito

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/9833208105954805
  • Última atualização do currículo em 15/03/2019

I am a Post-Doctoral researcher at the IAG/USP (Brazil), currently envolved in several astronomical surveys: - ALHAMBRA (www.alhambrasurvey.com) - CLASH (https://archive.stsci.edu/prepds/clash/) - J-PLUS (http://www.j-plus.es) - S-PLUS (http://www.iag.usp.br/labcosmos/en/s-plus/) - J-PAS (www.j-pas.org). My main research field are photometric redshifts. Projetos de pesquisa
2015 - Atual
J-PAS
Descrição: Javalambre Physics of the Accelerating Universe Astrophysical Survey, (J-PAS; Benítez et al. 2014), is an unprecedented photometric sky survey of 8500 deg2 visible from Javalambre in 59 colors, using a set of broad, intermediate and narrow band filters. J-PAS will discover an unprecedented number of stars, galaxies, supernovas, quasars and solar system objects, which will be mapped with exquisite accuracy. The innovative designs of the J-PAS camera and filter system will allow, for the first time, to map not only the positions of hundreds of millions of galaxies in the sky, but their individual distances to us as well, providing the first complete 3D map of the Universe..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (20) / Especialização: (30) / Mestrado acadêmico: (10) / Mestrado profissional: (10) / Doutorado: (30) .

Integrantes: Alberto Molino Benito - Integrante / CENARRO, A. J. - Integrante / VARELA, J. - Integrante / MARTÍNEZ, V. J. - Integrante / MOLES, M. - Integrante / ALFARO, E. - Integrante / CRISTOBAL-HORNILLOS, D. - Integrante / FERNANDEZ-SOTO, A. - Integrante / LOPEZ-SANJUAN, C. - Integrante / EDEROCLITE, A. - Integrante / VIIRONEN, K. - Integrante / BENITEZ, NARCISO - Coordenador / ABRAMO, L. R. - Integrante / MARIN-FRANCH, A. - Integrante / SODRE, L. - Integrante / DUPKE, R. - Integrante / CYPRIANO, E. - Integrante / MENDES DE OLIVEIRA, C. - Integrante.
2015 - Atual
J-PLUS
Descrição: The Javalambre-Photometric Local Universe Survey, J-PLUS, is an unprecedented photometric sky survey of 8500 deg2 visible from Javalambre, using a set of 12 broad, intermediate and narrow band filters. J-PLUS will be a powerful 3D view of the nearby Universe that will observe and characterize tens of millions of galaxies and stars of the Milky Way halo, with a wide range of Astrophysical applications..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Alberto Molino Benito - Integrante / CENARRO, A. J. - Coordenador / VARELA, J. - Integrante / ASCASO, B. - Integrante / JIMENEZ-TEJA, Y. - Integrante / CRISTOBAL-HORNILLOS, D. - Integrante / LOPEZ-SANJUAN, C. - Integrante / EDEROCLITE, A. - Integrante / VIIRONEN, K. - Integrante / ABRAMO, L. R. - Integrante / MARIN-FRANCH, A. - Integrante / SODRE, L. - Integrante / ALCANIZ, J. S. - Integrante / MENDES DE OLIVEIRA, C. - Integrante.
2015 - Atual
S-PLUS
Descrição: The Southern Photometric Local Universe Survey (S-PLUS; Mendes de Oliveira et al. in prep.) is a new project that will observe 8000 deg2 of the Southern Sky in a unique set of twelve optical bands. The filter system is composed of the 5 SDSS broad-band (BB) filters, supplemented by 7 narrow-band (NB) filters covering the main stellar features from 3700 to 9000\AA. S-PLUS is carried out using a fully robotic 0.8m telescope on Cerro Tololo. The camera has a 9kx9k E2V detector with a plate scale of 0.55\arcsec per pixel and a field of view of 2 deg2. The NB filters cover prominent features in nearby galaxies (i.e., OII, Ca H+K, D4000, H$\delta$, Mg$b$, H$\alpha$ and CaT), offering strong constraints on star formation histories as well as photometric redshifts of galaxies. They are furthermore highly suitable for searching for low-metallicity and carbon-enhanced stars, the blue horizontal branch and variable stars, and for mapping the Galactic plane..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (5) / Especialização: (10) / Mestrado acadêmico: (3) / Mestrado profissional: (10) / Doutorado: (30) .

Integrantes: Alberto Molino Benito - Integrante / SCHOENELL, W. - Integrante / ABRAMO, L. R. - Integrante / SODRE, L. - Integrante / CYPRIANO, E. - Integrante / MENDES DE OLIVEIRA, C. - Coordenador / Laura María Sampedro - Integrante.
2010 - 2016
CLASH survey
Descrição: The Cluster Lensing And Supernovae survey with Hubble (CLASH; Postman et al. 2012) is a Multi- Cycle Treasury program awarded with 524 HST orbits to image the cores of25 massive galaxy clusters at interme- diate redshifts (0.1Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

2005 - 2015
ALHAMBRA survey
Descrição: The Advance Large Homogeneous Medium Band Astronomical (ALHAMBRA; Moles et al. 2008) survey has observed eight different regions of the sky, including sections of the Cosmic Evolution Survey (COSMOS), DEEP2, European Large-Area Infrared Space Observatory Survey (ELAIS), Great Observatories Origins Deep Survey North (GOODS-N), Sloan Digital Sky Survey (SDSS) and Groth fields using a new photometric system with 20 optical, contiguous ∼300-Å filters plus the JHKs bands. The filter system is designed to optimize the effective photometric redshift depth of the survey, while having enough wavelength resolution for the identification of faint emission lines. The observations, carried out with the Calar Alto 3.5-m telescope using the wide-field optical camera Large Area Imager for Calar Alto (LAICA) and the near-infrared (NIR) instrument Omega-2000, represent a total of ∼700 h of on-target science images. The catalogues presented in Molino et al. 2014 are complete down to a magnitude I ∼ 24.5 AB and cover an effective area of 2.79 deg2. The ALHAMBRA Photometric Redshift estimates reach a precision of δz/(1 + zs) = 1% for I<22.5 and δz/(1+zs)=1.4% for 22.5Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (5) / Mestrado acadêmico: (10) / Mestrado profissional: (20) / Doutorado: (10) .

Integrantes: Alberto Molino Benito - Integrante / BENITEZ, N. - Coordenador / ASCASO, B. - Integrante / MOLES, M. - Integrante / AGUERRI, J. A. L. - Integrante / ALFARO, E. - Integrante / PRADA, F. - Integrante / CRISTOBAL-HORNILLOS, D. - Integrante / FERNANDEZ-SOTO, A. - Integrante / LOPEZ-SANJUAN, C. - Integrante / MARTINEZ, V.
